federal_out_nodes.summary_html: Child safely **reunified with parent or guardian**, case closed. Federal policy treats reunification as the preferred outcome once risk factors are mitigated.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **Adoption and Safe Families Act (ASFA)** ‚Äî establishes reunification timelines and permanency goals  
- **SSA Title IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 670‚Äì679c)** ‚Äî funds reunification services and tracks permanency outcomes
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Services successful; child safety assured; court orders case closure or dismisses petition.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Court approval; notice to parties; discharge orders; record retention per state/federal rules.

federal_out_nodes.summary_html: **Parental rights terminated** and **child adopted**. Federal law prioritizes timely permanency for children when reunification is not viable.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **ASFA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 671‚Äì675)** ‚Äî establishes 15/22-month TPR guideline  
- **SSA Title IV-E** ‚Äî adoption assistance and subsidy framework
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Court finds clear and convincing evidence parental rights should be terminated; adoption finalized.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Counsel for parents; clear-and-convincing-evidence standard; appellate review; compliance with ICWA where applicable.

federal_out_nodes.summary_html: Child achieves **permanency through legal guardianship** or kinship care. Federal programs provide funding parity with adoption for approved relatives.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **Fostering Connections to Success and Increasing Adoptions Act (FCSIAA)** ‚Äî kinship-guardianship assistance  
- **SSA Title IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß 673(d))** ‚Äî authorizes Guardianship Assistance Program (GAP)
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Court grants guardianship or legal custody to approved relative/kin; case closed.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Court hearing; background checks; ongoing subsidy eligibility; periodic review optional.
source_reference: FCSIAA and IV-E Guardianship Assistance references

federal_out_nodes.output_name: Extended Foster Care / Transitional Services (Aging Out)
federal_out_nodes.summary_html: Youth remains in **extended foster care** or receives **transitional services** after age 18 under federal programs promoting independence.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **Chafee Foster Care Independence Act (CFCIA)** ‚Äî independent-living and transition funding  
- **FCSIAA** ‚Äî extends care to age 21 with education and housing supports
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Youth elects or qualifies for continued placement/support after 18; transition plan approved.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Voluntary participation; eligibility review; notice of benefits and rights.

federal_out_nodes.summary_html: Case dismissed due to **unsubstantiated evidence** or court determination that allegations not proven. Federal oversight requires accurate recording of such closures for audit and funding compliance.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî defines data-collection standards for unfounded cases  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî requires tracking and reporting of unsubstantiated outcomes
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Evidence insufficient; allegations not substantiated; court or agency closes case.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Notice to family; record update; rights to seal or expunge per state law.
source_reference: CAPTA and CFSR data tracking standards

federal_out_nodes.summary_html: Case results in **child fatality or serious injury**, triggering mandatory federal and state review. Data and lessons inform systemic reform.
federal_out_nodes.authority_html:
- **Protect Our Kids Act (PL 112-275)** ‚Äî establishes national commission and reporting requirements  
- **CAPTA ¬ß5106a(b)(2)(A)(x)** ‚Äî mandates public disclosure and case review of fatalities
federal_out_nodes.outcome_basis: Child death or near-fatal incident during or following CPS involvement.
federal_out_nodes.due_process_hooks: Mandatory review by oversight body; federal/state reporting; confidentiality per CAPTA.
source_reference: Protect Our Kids Act and CAPTA fatality disclosure rules
